intro: Tetrapogon triangularis, commonly known as the triangular pogon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
